{"step_by_step_thinking": "The finger spring is used in orthodontics to tip teeth in a certain direction. According to Document [2], a force acting on a tooth can cause an opposite and equal force acting on the other side of the tooth. This can lead to a moment that results in tipping of the tooth. Therefore, the most common side effect of using a finger spring would be the tendency for the root apex to move in the direction opposite from the crown.", "answer_choice": "C"}
